data.title: movies | Video Games | 20
data.meta_description: Page 20. movies video games sorted by release date.
data.text:
Plan 9 from Outer Space

Adventure 12 June 1992

"The Worst Film in the History of Cinema" is the name of Plan 9 from Outer Space from 1959, directed by Ed Wood. In 1992, Gremlin Graphics decided to reach for the cult title in its own way and prepared an adventure game, loosely referring to the story told in the original.

PC

Indiana Jones and The Fate of Atlantis

Adventure 15 April 1992

LucasArts studio adventure in which we play the Jones Indians themselves. This time he explores the secrets of the legendary Atlantis, as usual fighting against the Nazis. The plot is not based on any of the films from this series. The game consists mainly of sightseeing the location, collecting objects and solving riddles.

PC

The Terminator

Action 31 October 1991

First-person action game, the first computer adaptation of a science fiction Terminator cashier film directed by James Cameron. While playing, we can play the role of Kyle Rees, trying to protect Sara Connor from a future cyborg, or the Terminator itself, whose task is to kill Sarah and her protector.

PC

Home Alone (1991)

Arcade 03 July 1991

A platform game based on the plot of a film under the same title. We play the title role of Kevin McCallister - a little boy left at home by accident by his parents leaving for Christmas. Our task is to defend the house against insidious robberies. Our main weapon are ingenious traps.

PC

Terminator 2: Judgement Day

Arcade 23 May 1991

Terminator 2: Judgement Day is an arcade game referring to the events of the film under the same title. The player will play the role of the T-800 cyborg, who must protect John Connor, the future leader of the resistance movement, from death.

PC

Back to the Future III

Arcade 12 March 1991

Back to the Future III is an arcade game, which plot refers to the third episode of the popular adventure film series, directed by Robert Zemeckis. This time Marty McFly will move in time until 1885, where he will try to prevent the murder of his friend Dr. Brown.

PC

The Blues Brothers

Arcade 12 March 1991

The Blues Brothers is an arcade game developed by Titus Interactive, which refers to John Landis' famous 1980 film with John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd in the leading roles.

PC

The Rocketeer

Arcade 02 February 1991

Arcade game based on the popular comic book and film under the same title. You play the role of Cliff Secord, a young pilot who accidentally becomes the owner of a jet backpack. He will use it to fight against the Nazis.

PC

RoboCop 3

Action 01 January 1991

OCP wants to demolish the poor old district of Detroit and create a future city called Delta City in its place. The problem is that the local residents, who are attached to their ruined homes, have no intention of moving out.

PC

Gremlins 2: The New Batch

Arcade 20 November 1990

Gremlins 2: The Elite New Batch is one of two arcade games, based on the story of a fantasy comedy popular in the early nineties. The action of the program throws us to New York, where, due to an unfortunate coincidence, extremely malicious creatures hatch.

PC

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

Adventure 29 October 1990

The third adventure game, written by LucasArts. Its plot is based on the plot of the last part of the trilogy about the adventures of Indiana Jones, concerning the search for St. Grail.

PC

Predator 2

Action 20 September 1990

Another shooting, which was based on the plot of a well-known action film. This time it's the second part of "Predator", a painting about the visit of space hunters on our planet. After a short reconnaissance, the title hunter chose a black policeman, Mike Harrigan, who has been active in actions against drug gangs for a long time.

PC

Batman: The Movie

Arcade 20 June 1989

Batman: The Movie is an arcade game, which, as you can easily guess, is based on the plot of the film under the same title. The player playing the role of the Dark Knight will have to curb the criminal drive of Joker and save the city of Gotham from extinction.

PC

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade: The Action Game

Arcade 25 May 1989

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade turned out to be such a profitable topic for LucasArts that it was decided to make not one, but two games based on the third part of the film adventures of the title archaeologist. Thus, not only the adventure game was published, but also the classic platforming game, in which more emphasis was put on the arcade character of the game.

PC

A Nightmare on Elm Street

Arcade 12 April 1989

A Nightmare on Elm Street is an arcade game from 1989, produced by Westwood Associates (better known as Westwood Studios). The program refers to Wes Craven's film of the same title, which tells the story of a group of teenagers fighting a psychopathic murderer - Freddym Kruger, murdering their victims in a dream.

PC

RoboCop (1989)

Arcade 12 March 1989

RoboCop is the conversion of a two-dimensional shooter created for coin-op machines in 1988. The plot of the game is based on Paul Verhoven's famous film, in which Alex Murphy, a policeman murdered with cold blood, already as RoboCop declares war on criminals from Detroit.

PC

Die Hard

Arcade 10 February 1989

Die Hard is a shootout which refers to the famous action film with Bruce Willis, under the same title. The player will play the role of John McClane, who declares war on ruthless terrorists occupying the forty-storey skyscraper Nakatomi Plaza.

PC

Rambo III

Action 23 April 1988

Rambo 3 is an arcade game based on a film under the same title. This time the brave commander goes to Soviet-occupied Afghanistan, from where he has to get out his superior, Colonel Trautman.

PC

Star Wars (1987)

Action 12 May 1987

Star Wars is a dynamic shooting set in the classic Star Wars trilogy by George Lucas and at the same time the first PC game, dealing with the Rebellian fight with the evil Darth Vader and his Empire.

PC

The Great Escape (1986)

Action 10 July 1986

The Great Escape is a great action game with an admixture of adventure elements, developed by Denton Design. You play the role of a prisoner whose only task is to escape from the camp under cover of the night. Several roads lead to the desired freedom, but each of them is equally dangerous. Only thanks to cleverness and a bit of luck can you succeed in outwitting German soldiers. It is worth to try, after all, you still have nothing to lose.

PC

James Bond 007: A View to Kill

Adventure 23 March 1985

An adventure text game whose main character is the famous British agent, James Bond. Of course, her plot refers to the film A View to Kill (in Poland known as the Deadly View) - the fourteenth in order of the series and also the last one in which Roger Moore performed.

PC

Bulletproof Monk

Adventure canceled

Action game based on the motifs of a film of the same title, telling the adventures of a certain nameless monk from the Far East, who for many years travelled around the globe guarding an ancient scroll of great power, and now has to find his successor.

PC
